oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-03-15 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 15, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hawkshaw Hawkins (host/performer), guest performer Jean Shepard, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 962nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hawkshaw Hawkins; Rod Brasfield; Jean Shepard; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- Sunny Side Of The Mountain (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Jean Shepard -- I Used To Love You (Jean Shepard) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Tommy Jackson -- Grey Eagle (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins talks -- Life's Railway To Heaven (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Chet Atkins -- Wildwood Flower (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Hawkins, Hawkshaw, 1921-1963; Shepard, Jean, 1933-
